fields.description:
*Assessment*

While verifying EUCA-10700, it was observed that the volume from ImportVolume was in the 'available' state _before_ the conversion task completed.
{code}
# euca-describe-conversion-tasks import-vol-29eb1eaa;date
TaskType	IMPORTVOLUME	TaskId	import-vol-29eb1eaa	ExpirationTime	Fri Apr 10 05:41:46 PDT 2015	Status	active	StatusMessage	Converting images
DISKIMAGE	DiskImageFormat	RAW	DiskImageSize	10000000000	VolumeId	vol-4a6be8ae	VolumeSize	10	AvailabilityZone	pimp-c	ApproximateBytesConverted	1237319680
Fri Apr  3 06:00:04 PDT 2015

# euca-describe-volumes vol-4a6be8ae;date
VOLUME	vol-4a6be8ae	10		pimp-c	available	2015-04-03T12:54:58.322Z	standard
Fri Apr  3 06:00:11 PDT 2015
{code}

This can cause workflow issues if the volume is attached before the conversion is complete.

*Steps*

# Set up Eucalyptus 4.1.1 (4.1.1-0.0.23155.62.20150401git5ef655c.el6) cloud
# Create non-eucalyptus account
# Create/download a raw image, and use euca-import-volume.  For example:
{code}
# euca-import-volume -f raw -z pimp-c -s 10 devel-core-amd64-disk1.raw --progress -d "Ubuntu Core (Snappy) Cloud Image Builds" -b ubuntu-core-20150402-account2-v3
Uploading image for task import-vol-29eb1eaa
devel-core-amd64-disk1.raw.part.0   (  1/954) 100% |=======================================================================================================|  10.00 MB  34.72 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
devel-core-amd64-disk1.raw.part.1   (  2/954) 100% |=======================================================================================================|  10.00 MB  17.32 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
devel-core-amd64-disk1.raw.part.2   (  3/954) 100% |=======================================================================================================|  10.00 MB  23.08 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
devel-core-amd64-disk1.raw.part.3   (  4/954) 100% |=======================================================================================================|  10.00 MB  23.09 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
...
...
devel-core-amd64-disk1.raw.part.953 (954/954) 100% |=======================================================================================================|   6.74 MB  15.40 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
TaskType	IMPORTVOLUME	TaskId	import-vol-29eb1eaa	ExpirationTime	Fri Apr 10 05:41:46 PDT 2015	Status	active
DISKIMAGE	DiskImageFormat	RAW	DiskImageSize	10000000000	VolumeSize	10	AvailabilityZone	pimp-c	ApproximateBytesConverted	0
{code}
# Monitor euca-describe-conversion-tasks to see when volume is created:
{code}
# euca-describe-conversion-tasks import-vol-29eb1eaa
TaskType	IMPORTVOLUME	TaskId	import-vol-29eb1eaa	ExpirationTime	Fri Apr 10 05:41:46 PDT 2015	Status	active	StatusMessage	Creating volumes
DISKIMAGE	DiskImageFormat	RAW	DiskImageSize	10000000000	VolumeId	vol-4a6be8ae	VolumeSize	10	AvailabilityZone	pimp-c	ApproximateBytesConverted	0
{code}
# Run euca-describe-volumes to see status of volume:
{code}
# euca-describe-volumes vol-4a6be8ae
VOLUME	vol-4a6be8ae	10		pimp-c	available	2015-04-03T12:54:58.322Z	standard
{code}
# Notice that conversion task is still running even though volume is in 'available' status:
{code}
# euca-describe-conversion-tasks import-vol-29eb1eaa;date
TaskType	IMPORTVOLUME	TaskId	import-vol-29eb1eaa	ExpirationTime	Fri Apr 10 05:41:46 PDT 2015	Status	active	StatusMessage	Converting images
DISKIMAGE	DiskImageFormat	RAW	DiskImageSize	10000000000	VolumeId	vol-4a6be8ae	VolumeSize	10	AvailabilityZone	pimp-c	ApproximateBytesConverted	1237319680
Fri Apr  3 06:00:04 PDT 2015

# euca-describe-volumes vol-4a6be8ae;date
VOLUME	vol-4a6be8ae	10		pimp-c	available	2015-04-03T12:54:58.322Z	standard
Fri Apr  3 06:00:11 PDT 2015
{code}
fields.summary: Volume from ImportVolume Shown 'Available' Before Importing Task Has Been Completed

comments.body: Proposed design is to include system instances into describe instances that have volumes attached and report volume in pending state while it remains attached to a system owned instance.

[~vasya], the expected behaviour is that users would not see system instances that were attached to their volumes (or any other instances that they did not own), either when describing instances or volume attachments and users would also see the volume state as "creating", rather than "in-use" or "available" when the volume was attached to a system instance.

[~sjones], agreed. I was trying to describe the same by adding notes to myself. The 'describe instance' in the comment is internal and not  for end-user. I think "creating" is a good idea for the status in this case.

Looks like checking volume attachment is not sufficient. Import process does not have to start right ways and volume can be created and be waiting for import for sometime. I am checking how AWS report those volumes.
AWS does not show volume at all until conversion process is completed.
[~vasya], this does not seem like an appropriate use of tags, it would be better to add additional state to the volume to fix this issue.
Tag are not ideal implementation. Revisiting solution.

[~zhill], [~sjones], new proposed design:
- add SystemManagedResourceType interface with Boolean getSystemManaged() function
- implement it in the com.eucalyptus.compute.common.internal.blockstorage.Volume class
- add  public static void setSystemManagedFlag (@Nonnull final String volumeId, boolean systemManaged) function to the com.eucalyptus.compute.common.internal.blockstorage.Volume class
- return false for all Volumes with unset systemManaged filed so there is no need for conversion
- set systemManaged flag to false/true where needed
- don't show volumes with systemManaged set to true for non system users
I am not sure about making this too generic right now, unless you think there is an immediate need for it.

[~vasya], sounds good, but Volumes#setSystemManagedFlag would be better than adding utility methods to Volume. Not sure on the value of the SystemManagedResourceType interface if there is only one resource using it and no generic functionality.

[~sjones], intuitively it seems like there would be other resources with similar lifecycle requirements in the future, but if we don't have any right now then no need to make it generic if that adds much work. Otherwise, sounds good, [~vasya].
New implementation is added in the 4f8c414a6ff50d72269a86fcaf1a953fe56deadc
I don't even see the volume before the import task finishes.
